text.section: A corporation shall keep as permanent records minutes of all meetings of its shareholders and board of directors, a record of all actions taken by the shareholders or board of directors without a meeting, and a record of all actions taken by a committee of the board of directors in place of the board of directors on behalf of the corporation.
A corporation shall maintain appropriate accounting records.

A corporation or its agent shall maintain a record of its shareholders, in a form that permits preparation of a list of the names and addresses of all shareholders, by class of shares showing the number and class of shares held by each.
A corporation shall maintain its records in written form or in another form capable of conversion into written form within a reasonable time.

law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 151, sec. 123, effective January 1, 2011. -- Created 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 23, sec. 167, effective January 1, 1989.
